definition[0]: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness
example[0]: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
example[1]: The cover protects the machine from dust.
example[2]: Physical exercise can protect you against heart disease.
example[3]: Waxing your car will help protect against rust.
definition[1]: if an insurance company protects your home, car, life etc, it agrees to pay you money if things are stolen or damaged or you are hurt or killed
example[4]: Unemployment insurance means that you are partially protected if you lose your job.
explanation[0]: Protect is usually passive in this meaning
definition[2]: to help the industry and trade of your own country by taxing or restricting foreign goods
example[6]: The government wants to protect the environment.
example[7]: Eating healthily helps to protect against many diseases.
definition[3]: to protect someone from something harmful
example[8]: Wearing a hat offers some protection from the sun.
example[9]: The drug can give protection against cancer.
definition[4]: to protect a person, place, or object by staying near them and watching them
example[11]: Police officers guarded the entrance to the building.
example[12]: He is guarded by armed men.
definition[5]: to protect someone or something when they are in danger of being harmed or destroyed
example[13]: Local people are fighting to save the theatre from demolition.
example[14]: Emergency aid could save millions of people who are threatened with starvation.
definition[6]: to keep something, especially buildings or the environment, from being harmed, destroyed, or changed too much
example[15]: The organization works to preserve forests.
example[16]: There is little money for preserving historic buildings.
definition[7]: to protect something important, such as people’s rights, interests, jobs, health etc
example[17]: The deal will safeguard 200 jobs at the factory.
example[18]: Laws should do more to safeguard the rights of victims.
definition[8]: to put something in front of something else to protect it. Also used to talk about protecting people from unpleasant situations
example[19]: He lifted his hand to shield his eyes from the light.
example[20]: They thought the public should be shielded from the truth.
definition[9]: to provide a place where someone or something is protected from the weather or from danger
example[21]: The village is sheltered by a belt of trees.
example[22]: His family had sheltered Jews during the war.
definition[10]: to help and protect someone who has done something illegal, and prevent the police from finding them
example[23]: He is accused of harbouring suspected terrorists.
definition[11]: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, bad influences etc
example[24]: laws protecting the rights of disabled people
example[25]: P&G wants to protect its $180 million investment by obtaining a 10-year extension of three patents.
example[26]: The wage index system protects workers against inflation.
definition[12]: to try to help an industry in your own country by taxing foreign goods that are competing with it, so limiting the number that can be imported
example[27]: For decades, the Mexican government protected its domestic growers by regulating corn imports.
definition[13]: to provide insurance against damage to your home, car, etc
example[28]: Having unemployment insurance means that you are partially protected if you lose your job.
